column_.text_: Attacks

Press  to attack nearby foes.
When playing as the captain, mix in  attacks to create
various combos.
Attacks

Press  to unleash a character's unique attack. Some unique
attacks can be charged up by holding down the button, like
the captain's  attack.
Incoming Danger

When a foe glows red, watch out! Be prepared to guard or
dodge the powerful attack that's about to come.
Guarding
Hold  to block enemy attacks.

But beware! Taking too many hits while guarding will result
in a guard break, and you'll become temporarily dazed.
Dodging

Press  to dodge attacks and avoid taking damage. You can
dodge multiple times in a row, but doing so will leave you
wide open after the final dodge!
Lock On

Press  to have the camera automatically follow a target.
While locked onto a target, move  to switch targets. Press
 again to disengage lock on.
Skills
Hold  and press , , , or  to activate a skill.

Skills go on cooldown after activation, represented by their
icons going dark. Some skills, however, allow for multiple
activations.
Support Skills

Every character has their own support skills. One of the
captain's support skills is called Adept Arts, which enhances
the abilities of activated skills.
Recovery Items

Hold  to use recovery items. Medicine might taste bitter,
but it's better than biting the dust!
Elemental Properties

Every character's attacks and skills have an elemental
property. The element is represented by a colored icon next
to the character or skill. The captain's element is wind.
Elemental Weakness

Foes take more damage from elements they're weak to, which
is represented by the icon next to their health gauge. The
timber wolf is weak to the captain's wind element.
Link Attack

A foe's stun gauge fills up as it takes hits. Once its
stun gauge is full, a link chance will trigger.

Press  during a link chance to perform a link attack with
your party members.
Link Level

Performing certain actions such as link attacks raises the
party's link level. If all party members perform a link
attack at 100% link level, you'll gain temporary buffs.
Mode Bar and Boss Status

A boss's mode bar fills up as it takes damage.
Once full, the boss goes into Overdrive and becomes even
more dangerous.

Conversely, a boss's mode bar depletes as it takes damage
while in Overdrive. Once the bar is depleted, it enters
Break. That's your chance to lay on the hurt!
Skybound Arts

Press  +  when your Skybound Art gauge is full to unleash
a devastating attack. Your Skybound Art gauge is underneath
your health gauge.
Chain Burst

When multiple Skybound Arts are activated in succession, it
triggers a powerful final attack called a chain burst. Try
chaining everyone's SBAs together for a full burst!
Inventory

Items you've collected on your adventure are stored in your
Inventory. Consumables such as spellbooks and ambrosia are
usable from this menu.
Wish List

Select a treasure and press  to add it to your wish list.
When you visit the Knickknack Shack or quest counter, items
on your wish list will be marked with an icon for your
convenience!
Treasure Hunting

Add a treasure to your wish list, and then head over to the
quest counter. There you'll be able to search for quests
that have the item on your wish list!
Lyria's Journal

Lyria takes many notes as the journey continues. Check out
her journal for useful tips and information.
Trophies

Accomplish various feats on your journey to earn shiny
trophies. Some trophies even come with rewards!

Select Co-Op Settings from the main menu, and then
Edit Profile to show off your favorite trophy!
Navigating Towns

Icons displayed at the top of the screen indicate where
useful facilities are located. The  icon points to the
next story objective.

You can save your game at any time from the main menu while
in town.
Fate Episodes

Fate episodes are special character-specific stories. More
episodes are unlocked as the game progresses and characters
level up.
Sierokarte's Knickknack Shack

Sierokarte is a renowned merchant who offers a plethora of
goods and services to travelers and residents alike.
In fact, let's trade with her right now.

Looks like you have enough Rafale coins to trade for
fortitude shards.
Enter the number of shards you want and then select Trade.
Blacksmith

The blacksmith takes care of all things weapon-related.
You can also sell your items here.

Let's use the fortitude shards you traded for earlier to
level up the captain's weapon.

Select the number of shards you want to use on the weapon.
The weapon's level will increase based on how many shards
are used.
Auto Level

Press  to automatically select the most suitable materials
for leveling up the chosen weapon. This feature makes
upgrading a breeze.
Crewmate Card

Give this card to Sierokarte, and she'll call in a new
crewmate for you.
Unlocking Characters

Use crewmate cards to unlock new party members to join you
on your journey. The more the merrier!
Gear

Don't forget to equip sigils and weapons! They're vital
for survival.
Weapons

Weapons boost a character's health and attack power when
equipped. They also have their own traits.
Sigils

Sigils grant additional effects when equipped. Be sure to
check out the stats of any new sigils you come across!
Skills

Be sure to assign skills to your characters in order to use
them. New skills can be learned from Masteries.
Assigning Skills

Skills can be assigned to , , , and .
Experiment with different skills to match your play style!
System

Various options can be changed from the System menu. You
can also save your game.
Quest Counter

Take on various quests from the quest counter and earn
valuable rewards for clearing them.

Select Play Online to challenge quests with other players.
Give it a shot when you're in the mood for some co-op play!

Quests can be played online with other players by either
creating an online party or searching for a party to join.
Questing

Crew Alliance Rafale is always stocked with quests for the
intrepid skyfarer. Quests are organized by location,
difficulty, and type.
Unlocking More Difficult Quests

Keep clearing quests that have the  icon to access more
challenging quests.
Departing on a Quest

After accepting a quest, make sure you have everything ready, then
press  to confirm you're ready. Once all players are ready,
you'll automatically depart.
Requesting a Quest

You can request a quest for the party leader to undertake.
The request remains active until undertaken or you cancel
the request.
Session Settings

Session settings allows you to configure your online play
experience to your liking. These settings apply to all
players that join your session.
Session Settings

You'll need to set up your session before going online.
These settings will apply to all players that join your
session.
Matchmaking Settings

Select Closed to play a quest with only your current party
members, or select Open to play with random players.
Searching for an Online Party

You can search for an online party (also known as a session)
that matches your criteria. To play with friends or players
you follow, select Search by Player List.
Inviting Players to an Online Party

You can invite friends, players who have recently appeared
online, and players you're following to a session you've
created.
Selling Items

Items can be sold for rupies. However, they can't be bought
back. Keep that in mind before making a sale.
Playing Online

If you want to quest with other players, head to the quest
counter and select Create Online Party or Search for Online
Party.

Chat with other skyfarers by pressing  to access stickers
and emotes, or hold  to bring up the shortcut wheel. These
are customizable from Co-Op Settings.
Quick Matchmaking

This allows you to configure your online session.
You'll be able to challenge optional quests with other players.
Player List

You can view other players' profiles, follow them, or send
them party invites directly.
Player Profile

Show the Sky Realm what kind of skyfarer you are through
your profile.
Communication Features

A wide range of tools are available to help you quickly and
easily communicate with other players.
Online Status

Online status icons let other party members know at a glance
what you're up to.
Locked Treasure Chests

Some chests require a special key to open. There should be
something good in there if it's locked, right?
Shrouded Treasure

Opening these tantalizing treasure chests takes a little
extra legwork. Touch the chest and collect all of the mirage
stones before they disappear to earn your reward.
Omen Stone

Omen stones can be found throughout Zegagrande.
Traveler beware—mighty foes are sealed within.

Defeat all of the released foes within the time limit, and
you'll be handsomely rewarded.
If the enemy is too much to handle, retreat to fight
another day.
Party

Up to 4 characters can be in your party at one time.
It's your choice who you want to adventure with!
Party Formation

Let's make a party of 4. The character in the leftmost slot
is the one you control. The captain must be in the party for
the main story, but you can play as any character you like.
Overcoming Tough Foes

Clear quests to raise your level and get resources for
upgrading weapons and sigils. You'll also earn mastery
points (MSP), used for unlocking new skills and stats.
Unlock Fate Episodes!

Learn more about a character by viewing their fate episodes.
It's also a good way to gain extra stat boosts. Fate
episodes are accessed from the quest counter.
Masteries

Characters gain mastery points (MSP) upon leveling up.
Mastery points are spent to raise stats, learn skills, and more.

Now would be a perfect time to see that in action.
Let's have the captain acquire a new skill.
Mirage Munitions

A mirage munition raises a weapon's stats when fused onto
it. They can be freely added or removed. Up to 99 munitions
can be fused to a single weapon.
Docks

Use the docks to fly to another town or board the
Grandcypher's deck. If you return to town during a story
mission, you'll disembark at the docks.
Hallowed Ground

Hallowed Ground fully heals all party members and
replenishes your recovery items. Don't pass up the chance
to make a pit stop.
New Hallowed Ground Features

Services offered by Siero's Knickknack Shack and the
blacksmith can now be accessed from Hallowed Ground.
Talk about convenience!
Don't Forget to Equip Sigils!

Now that you've obtained a sigil, you have to equip it in
order to take advantage of its effects!
Chapter Select

Replay your favorite story beats while finding secrets and
chests you might've missed. It's also a good way to
strengthen your characters. You can quit a chapter at any time.
Uncapping Level Caps

Refinium is a resource that increases a weapon's level
limit. This is called uncapping. Uncapped weapons can be
leveled up further, which may unlock new traits.
New Shop Feature Available

A new feature has been added to the blacksmith. The "!" mark
on a facility's icon means there's something new worth
checking out.
Weapon Collection Bonuses

You can now spend MSP to boost the stats of a weapon's
wielder. That character keeps the stat boosts even if the
weapon isn't equipped.
Forging Weapons

A champion merit is a resource needed for forging weapons.
Make your journey easier by creating a variety of weapons
for any situation.
Upgrading Sigils

Sigils can now be upgraded at the blacksmith. The higher the
sigil's level, the stronger its trait effect becomes. Sigil
rarity determines its level cap.
Fast Travel

You've unlocked the ability to instantly travel between town
services by pressing . To fly to other islands, head to
the docks.
Deck of the Grandcypher

Interact with Sir Barrold to start Training. To return to
town, interact with the ship's wheel.
Operating Tayu'itar

The Tayu'itar is now at your disposal. Give Avia a taste of
their own medicine!
Rolan's Notes

You've found a journal belonging to Rolan, but you may find
more out in the world by doing other quests. His entries are
saved in the archives of Lyria's Journal.
Quick Quests

The quick quest feature allows you to depart on a random
quest that you've unlocked. Clearing a quick quest awards
Dalia badges. Trade them to Siero for valuable items.

When playing quick quests with online players, your stats
may be adjusted if your PWR greatly exceeds the advised PWR.
Moreover, using gold badge tickets grants bonus gold badges.
Knickknack Vouchers

Knickknack vouchers are required to transmute new
sigils. You can trade treasure and sigils to Sierokarte for
vouchers.
Transmuting Sigils

Knickknack vouchers are used at the Knickknack Shack to
obtain new sigils at random. If luck is on your side, you
might even walk away with very rare sigils.
Transmarvel

The transmarvel feature is now available.
Every transmutation fills a gauge. You'll be able to
transmarvel every time the gauge completely fills up.
Trading Dalia Badges

You can now trade Dalia badges for items. Badges are
obtained from quick quests and come in gold and silver.
Zathba's Appraisal

Stumbled across a curio? Get it looked at by Zathba, and
he'll give you an item for it (maybe even a rare one).
Wrightstone Imbuement

A weapon imbued with a wrightstone gains the wrightstone's
traits. Imbuing the same weapon with a different wrightstone
overwrites its current wrightstone traits.
Side Quests

Townspeople marked with an icon are in need of help. A good
deed never goes unrewarded.
Side Quest Screen

The Side Quest screen organizes all the side quests you've
encountered. You can also use it to instantly travel to a
client.
Controlling the Captain

This young man is on a journey to reach Estalucia.
He's a solid choice for any situation and learns all types of
skills for offense, defense, healing, and support.

The captain creates various combos using  and .
His  attack is chargeable for more power.

Pulling off combos raises the captain's Adept Arts level.
Skills become more powerful at higher Adept Arts levels,
so master those combos!
Controlling the Captain

This young woman is on a journey to reach Estalucia.
She's a solid choice for any situation and learns all types of
skills for offense, defense, healing, and support.

The captain creates various combos using  and .
Her  attack is chargeable for more power.

Pulling off combos raises the captain's Adept Arts level.
Skills become more powerful at higher Adept Arts levels,
so master those combos!
Controlling Katalina

A former knight of the Erste Empire, Katalina fights to
protect Lyria. Wielding a magic sword, she's an adept
warrior who adapts to any situation.

Katalina creates various combos by using  and .
Repeatedly press  to unleash a sweeping slash attack.

Pulling off combos fills the Ares gauge. Once the gauge is
full, Katalina can summon primal beast Ares to bolster her
combos, skills, and Skybound Art.
Controlling Rackam

Rackam is a man of the skies tasked with helming the
Grandcypher. His two guns allow him to cover allies at 
both long and close range.

Press  to fire once, or hold to fire a 3-shot burst.
His  attack is chargeable, which increases its range
and damage.

Skills and  attacks fill the Heat gauge. His  attack
charges faster the higher the Heat gauge.
Controlling Io

Io is a young mage who aspires to be an elegant lady. She's
able to cast long-range spells and heal the party with
recovery magic.

casts a ball of magic while  hits foes in a wide area.
Her  is chargeable, and it grants her a Mystic Vortex orb.

The number of orbs she has determines how high she can
charge her  attack to. Charging it up to max level
is when the real magic happens!
Controlling Eugen

This old soldier fights foes while battling his own demons.
Able to snipe weaknesses from afar, he's also adept at
hand-to-hand combat.

Hold  to enter sniper vision. He won't be able to move
while in sniper vision, but he'll be able to manually aim
his shots. This is especially useful for destroying body parts.

Grenades deal damage to foes in their blast zone. Hold  to
aim the throw. Grenades explode after a period of time, or
can be detonated by an attack.
Controlling Rosetta

Rosetta, a woman shrouded in mystery, is actually
the incarnation of primal beast Rose Queen. She makes
beautiful roses bloom on the battlefield.

Her  attacks have decent reach, and  plants roses.
Roses planted on the battlefield will automatically attack
foes within range. Hold  to pick a planting spot.

Roses level up by hitting foes, boosting their effectiveness.
Whenever Rosetta ends a combo with , party members inside
a rose's radius are granted a buff.
Controlling Ferry

Ferry, a young Erune from an island shrouded in mist, passed
away a long time ago and became a ghost. With her
spirited pets by her side, she's a whip-wielding powerhouse.

Take advantage of her whip's long reach and hold  to
deliver a barrage of blows. One of her pets will be summoned
on the last hit.

Hold  to unleash a storm of blows over a wide area.
If any pets are present on the battlefield, they'll hop in
on the beatdown.
Controlling Lancelot

Wielding dual blades, Lancelot leads Feendrache's Order of
the White Dragons. He employs his icy blades to cut down 
his enemies with dazzling skill and speed.

Lancelot will continuously attack in place for as long as
you repeatedly tap . Cap off a series of  attacks with
 to unleash a powerful finisher!

Move the  stick while pressing  to dodge in that direction
while attacking. Run circles around your enemy and finish
them off before they can react!
Controlling Vane

Vane is the cheerful vice-captain of Feendrache's Order of
the White Dragons. When it comes to battles, he's often
seen charging headlong into enemy lines.

Press  to overwhelm foes with powerful slashes. His wide
 swings allow him to block and attack at the same time.

Pulling off combos fills the Beatdown gauge. Vane can
perform powerful  combos as long as he has enough gauge
to sustain the combos.
Controlling Percival

Dubbed the Lord of Flames, this knight visits nations to
gain knowledge on how to create his own ideal country. Armed
with sword and magic, all foes wither before his might.

Press  repeatedly to perform a combo.
His  attack is chargeable for more power.

Percival can charge his  attack even while on the move.
Furthermore, he won't flinch if he gets hit by an attack
while charging.
Controlling Siegfried

The blood of a dragon flows through the veins of this
powerful knight. He swings his greatsword with ease and
cleaves enemies in twain.

Press  repeatedly to perform a combo. Press  to
perform a lunging attack that foes will have a hard time
interrupting.

His  attacks will hit even harder when chained together in
a combo with perfect timing.
Controlling Charlotta

Charlotta's heart is as big as the oversized weapon in her
hand. As the captain of the Lumiel Order of Holy Knights,
her duty is to ensure that evil never prevails.

Keep pressing  for a flurry of slashes that get stronger
when sustained, and then unleash a powerful attack at the
end by pressing .

Charlotta leaps into the air with the press of  and does a
whirling slash as she lands. However, she can also perform
different attacks by pressing  or  during the leap.
Controlling Yodarha

Yodarha was once a renowned swordsman with many disciples.
He handles two swords at will with blinding speed, making
him adept at high-speed combos and counters.

Press  after a  combo for a fearsome finisher that can be
chained into another combo. The chained combos will get
shorter, meaning more chances to execute finishers.

Yodarha gains a Triple Shroud mark whenever he completes a
combo. Triple Shroud marks enhance the next skill used and
are automatically consumed upon activation.
Controlling Narmaya

Narmaya is a blademaster who combined her family's martial
arts with magic to form her own unique blade techniques.
She employs two distinct stances in battle.

Press  to switch between Freeflutter stance and Dawnfly
stance. Freeflutter is geared toward performing fast combos.
In Dawnfly, her charged attacks hit all foes within range.

Narmaya gains a butterfly whenever she lands a charged  in
Dawnfly stance or completes a Freeflutter combo. Butterflies
enhance the next skill used and are automatically consumed
upon skill activation.
Controlling Ghandagoza

Ghandagoza, founder of the Eternal Rage Style, believes he
can accomplish anything with only the might of his fist.
Any foe within his reach will be pulverized into dust.

Press  repeatedly to perform combos, but know that
well-timed attacks are stronger than button-mashing.
Completing a combo raises his Eternal Rage.

The power of his charged  attack increases based on how
much Eternal Rage he has. He'll gradually lose Eternal Rage
if he takes too long to inflict pain on a foe.
Controlling Zeta

Zeta works for the Society, a group that hunts primal
beasts. She's armed with a seal weapon named Arvess, and
she excels at counters and speedy aerial attacks.

She'll high jump off of a foe after using a  combo or
certain skills. Press  while airborne to dive bomb the foe.
With well-timed  presses, she'll enter an attack loop.

Pressing  allows Zeta to set up for a counter, and if
successful, she'll high jump after countering. Press  or 
while airborne to perform different attacks.
Controlling Vaseraga

Vaseraga works for the Society, a group that hunts primal
beasts. He's armed with a seal weapon named Great Scythe
Grynoth. To foes, he's the grim reaper incarnate.

Vaseraga combines  and  to create combos. Press  to
grant the Stout Heart status effect to himself.

Vaseraga can charge his  attack following a  attack.
Landing charged  attacks fills the Grynoth gauge, which
grants various buffs once the gauge reaches certain levels.
Controlling Cagliostro

Cagliostro claims to be the founder of alchemy, and she
uses it to transmute implements of murder that foes want no
part of.

She creates various combos using  and .
Her  attack is chargeable for more power.

Cagliostro's combo finisher changes based on the number of
 attacks performed before the finisher. Try to use the
best combo for the situation.
Controlling Id

Id is a swordsman who has overcome the harsh fate imposed
upon him. He overwhelms his enemies with the power of
destruction.

Press  repeatedly to perform combos, or  to lunge at a
foe. His  is also chargeable for more power.

Landing a charged  attack or following up with a  attack
fills the Versalis gauge. Once the gauge is full, Id enters
Dragonform, enhancing his attacks.
Falling in Battle

When your HP hits 0, you'll enter critical condition and
won't be able to fight. Rapidly tap any button to recover
faster, or hold  to use a revival potion.

Hold  on a party member in critical condition to rescue
them. They'll recover even faster if more members join the
rescue.
Critical Gauge

It's game over once the critical gauge runs out. The gauge
constantly depletes as long as any party member is in a
critical state, so rescue them quickly!
Bloodthirst

Some bosses gain the Bloodthirst effect. It makes Skybound
Arts ineffective and greatly reduces the damage taken.
Thankfully, the effect is only temporary.
Link Time

Link time is triggered when link level is at 100% and
each party member performs a link attack.

During link time, enemy movement is slowed, and you're
granted various effects such as increased attack power,
health regeneration, and shorter skill cooldowns.
Over Mastery

Once a character reaches level 80, they can get even
stronger by spending mastery points to gain random
stat boosts.
Loadouts

The weapon, sigils, and skills you have equipped can be
saved as a loadout. You can also edit each loadout's name
and icon.
Party Sets

Save party formations, weapons, sigils, and skills as party
sets for greater convenience. You can also edit each set's
name and icon.
Weapon Awakening

Ascension weapons that have reached their maximum level can
now be upgraded even further at the Knickknack Shack. Doing
so will unlock hidden power, but it won't come cheap.
Curios

You've acquired a curio. Zathba will be interested in taking
a closer look at it.
The Power That Sleeps Within

You've leveled an Ascension weapon as far as it can go, but
it still seems to have untapped power. It couldn't hurt to
ask Sierokarte about it.
Changing Skybound Arts Modes

Press  and then  to command your party members to either
automatically use their Skybound Arts or hold them for later.
Lil Pince

This boy rescues rare creatures called wee pincers. If you
find one, he'd be happy to take it in.
Wee Pincers

Wee pincers are rare creatures that hide throughout
Zegagrande. There may be someone out there who seeks these
critters.
Archives

Check out the archives in Lyria's Journal to read notes and
other documents you've picked up along your travels.
What Happens After Reaching Max Level?

Characters will still earn experience after reaching the
maximum level. Once they've stockpiled enough experience,
you'll receive Knickknack vouchers and mastery points.
Traveling Between Towns

Congratulations on reaching Seedhollow. Fast traveling
between Seedhollow and Folca is now available from the docks
or the deck of the Grandcypher.
Increasing Your Survival Chances

Try tackling some quests and side quests. Don't forget to
upgrade your weapons and sigils too!
Ultimate Difficulty

Ultimate difficulty has been added to Chapter Select. Put
your skills to the ultimate test, and earn rarer loot from
your triumphs.
Camera and Movement Controls

Move your character with , and control the camera with .
Camera controls are configurable via game options.
Jumping and Dashing

Press  to jump.
Press  while moving to dash.
Move
Adjust camera
Dash
Jump
Attack
Unique Attack
Dodge
Guard
Lock On
Close
